revised_title: Long-term Effects of Oil Pollution on Marine Populations and Ecosystems
tldr: This study examines the long-term effects of oil pollution on marine populations and ecosystems, focusing on the physiological and biochemical responses of marine molluscs to petroleum compounds. The research discusses the challenges of comparing laboratory experiments to real-world situations and the ecological consequences of sublethal effects of hydrocarbons on marine life. The findings suggest that oil pollution can lead to reduced feeding rates, increased energy expenditure, and impaired reproductive success, ultimately affecting the health and survival of marine populations.
